p: The cluster analysis (Fig.Â 4) assembled the plant species into three groups (A, B and C). Cluster A (99% similarity) included C. annum, C. chinense and S. paniculatum, which were classified as unsuitable for T. absoluta. Cluster B denominated as the intermediate group, was divided into two subclusters (B1 and B2). Subcluster B1 (92% similarity) grouped S. aculeatissimum and S. americanum together. Subcluster B2 (80.76% similarity) consisted of S. gilo, S. melongena and S. habrochaites. Cluster C, considered as the most susceptible host plants group (78.40% similarity), consisting of S. lycopersicum and S. tuberosum.
